Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Racer \Ra"cer\ (r[=a]"s[~e]r), n. 1. One who, or that which, races, or contends in a race; esp., a race horse. [1913 Webster]
And bade the nimblest racer seize the prize. --Pope. [1913 Webster]
2. (Zo["o]l.) The common American black snake. [1913 Webster]
3. (Mil.) One of the circular iron or steel rails on which the chassis of a heavy gun is turned. [1913 Webster]

racer n 1: someone who drives racing cars at high speeds [syn: {race driver}, {automobile driver}] 2: a fast car that competes in races [syn: {race car}, {racing car}] 3: an animal that races 4: slender fast-moving North American snakes
